IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: The University offers a quality education in a biblically sound, Christ-centered environment.
IRS990.MissionDescription: North Greenville University believes that the truths found in Holy Scriptures permeate every aspect of reality. All truth is ultimately from God. Therefore, a commitment to academic excellence can be an integral component in the maturation of one's faith. Faculty members meet regularly to study ways in which matters of faith can be brought into the classroom experience. Students are encouraged to participate in the process of integrating faith and learning. North Greenville University strives to be a place where graduates will leave with both and understanding of their chosen fields of endeavor and an appreciation for how the truths of scripture apply to those areas. The University offers the following degrees: the Bachelor of Arts degree, the Bachelor of Science degree, the Master of Business Administration degree, and the Master of Christian Ministries degree. Within the undergraduate degrees there are 31 program options and choices of major.
IRS990.Description: The University is a co-educational liberal arts university offering graduate and undergraduate degrees. It has Level III membership in the Commission of Colleges of the Southern Association of Colleges and Schools. The University's purpose is to provide opportunities for higher education in a Christian atmosphere. The University provided education services to 2,514 students.

OtherLiabilities.Description: Funds held in federal loan programs

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Intended Use of Endowment Funds:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: The University uses most earnings from endowment funds to provide scholarship assistance to worthy students, as designated by donors. A small portion of earnings are used to provide programs as designated by donors and the Board of Trustees.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Uncertain Tax Positions Under FIN 48:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: On June 1, 2009, the University adopted the new provisions of the Income Tax topic of the ASC. These provisions clarify the accounting for uncertainty in tax positions and prescribe guidance related to the financial statement recognition and measurement of a tax position taken or expected to be taken in a tax return. The tax benefit from an uncertain tax position is only recognized in the statement of financial position if the tax position is more likely than not to be sustained upon an examination, based on the technical merits of the position. Interest and penalties, if any, are included in expenses in the statement of activities. As of May 31, 2010, the University had no uncertain tax positions that qualify for recognition or disclosure in the financial statements.
Change in value of trust: 171770. Scholarships netted with revenue: -11255209.
Fundraising expenses reported on Part VII, Line 8B: -48264.
Fundraising expenses reported on Part VIII, Line 8B: 48264.

IRS990ScheduleE.PubViaBroadcastMediaExpln: No media solicitation is generated. Non-discrimination policy is included in catalog which goes to all prospective students this information is also included in all admissions materials.
IRS990ScheduleE.GovtFinancialAidExplanation: Federal financial aid funds under Title IV are received by the University and awarded and disbursed to its students.

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Identifier: Procedure for Monitoring Grants in the U.S.:
Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2: The financial aid planning office requires students to complete the free application for federal student aid (FAFSA) form to determine eligibility for federal, state and institutional grants, scholarships and loans. This is an equitable formula that measures all assets consistently. In addition to this form, the institution does require some other guidelines in the event that funds are offered based on certain academic credentials or performance in a university sponsored activity or athletic event. These credentials are clearly stated in the university catalog and the university website. Enrollment and eligibility are monitred by the university.

Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Explanation: The President and Vice President of Business Affairs are required to live on the University's main campus. The homes are University property and are adjacent to the University.

Form990ScheduleLPartIII.TypeOfAssistance: Scholarships -approved by an independent financial aid committee Amount $ 28200.

Form990ScheduleMPartII.Identifier: Method for Determining Number of Contributors:
Form990ScheduleMPartII.Explanation: The number of contributors represent the number of donors.
The University uses a third party broker to receive and sell donated securities and vehicles.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Form 990 was prepared by an independent accountant and reviewed by the University's top management. The reviewed Form 990 was then forwarded to the University's Board prior to filing.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The trustees and officers must sign a conflict of interest policy annually.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The Executive Committee of the Board of Trustees reviews the salary and benefits of the President and decides what the new contract amounts will be. Periodically, the Board will review comparable salaries.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 18
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The University makes its Form 1023 and Form 990 available to the interested public upon request. Form 990 is also available for public review at another's website, www.guidestar.org.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The University does not provide its governing documents, conflict of interest policy, and financial statements to the public.

The University has an Executive Committee that assumes responsibility for oversight of the audit of its financial statements. The selection of the University's independent accountant is made by the South Carolina Baptist Convetion. The process has not changed since the prior year.

NameOfDisregardedEntity.BusinessNameLine1: The Baptist Foundation of South Carolina

Form990ScheduleRPartII.PrimaryActivities: Institution of SCBC designated for the management of trust funds
